intro: Nasa santa-martae, commonly known as the Santa Marta mountain morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the cloud forests of the Santa Marta mountains in Colombia. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers that bloom in the early morning. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces tendrils that help it climb and support its growth. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is adapted to the high-altitude conditions of its native habitat. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
